article.headline: No. 1 Alabama beats No. 4 Oklahoma 45-34 to reach title game
article.description: This season's Alabama juggernaut has yet to be stopped, and Oklahoma's suspect defense sure wasn't going to do it.
article.linkText: No. 1 Alabama beats No. 4 Oklahoma 45-34 to reach title game

images.name: Murray launches 49-yard TD to Rambo
images.caption: Kyler Murray keeps Oklahoma alive with a perfect 49-yard touchdown pass to Charleston Rambo in the third quarter.

video.headline: Murray launches 49-yard TD to Rambo
video.caption: Kyler Murray keeps Oklahoma alive with a perfect 49-yard touchdown pass to Charleston Rambo in the third quarter.
video.title: Murray launches 49-yard TD to Rambo
video.description: Kyler Murray keeps Oklahoma alive with a perfect 49-yard touchdown pass to Charleston Rambo in the third quarter.

tracking.trackingName: NCF_One-Play (Murray launches 49-yard TD to Rambo) 2018/12/29 ESHEET

article.story: MIAMI GARDENS, Fla. -- This season's Alabama juggernaut has yet to be stopped, and Oklahoma's shaky defense sure wasn't going to get in the way. Maybe Clemson can. Tua Tagovailoa threw for 318 yards and four touchdowns and No. 1-ranked Alabama beat No. 4 Oklahoma 45-34 on Saturday night in the College Football Playoff semifinal at the Orange Bowl . The high-scoring Sooners reached the semifinal despite a porous defense that was no match for Alabama's diverse attack, and the defending champion Crimson Tide led 28-0 after only 17 minutes. Alabama (14-0) advanced to the national championship game for the fourth consecutive season and will play Jan. 7 in Santa Clara, California against familiar foe Clemson, which beat Notre Dame 30-3 in the Cotton Bowl. The Tigers, ranked No. 2, and Alabama will face off in the playoffs for the fourth year in a row, and have split two title games. "They've got a great program and a great team," Alabama coach Nick Saban said. "I'm sure it'll be a great challenge for us, and I'm sure we'll need to play better than we did today." Saban spiked his headset during one of his several sideline tirades. He lobbed oranges during the postgame celebration. "It was more fun throwing the oranges," he said. Tagovailoa's performance argued for a Florida recount in the Heisman Trophy vote. He finished as the runner-up to Oklahoma's Kyler Murray but won sweet consolation by completing 24 of 27 passes, with scores to four receivers. "It's always good to see your hard work pay off," said Tagovailoa, who played on a sore left ankle. His completion percentage was an Orange Bowl record. While Tagovailoa connected on his first nine passes for 184 yards, Murray was sacked twice before he threw a pass, and his first completion came with his team already down 21-0. "The slow start got us beat," Murray said. "It's tough to come back from that." Murray had one brilliant moment, a perfect deep throw on the move to Charleston Rambo in the end zone for a 49-yard score. He passed for 308 yards and ran for 109 but took several jarring hits, including when All-America nose guard Quinnen Williams dislodged his helmet and forced him from the game for one play in the fourth quarter. The Sooners (12-2) came up short in a bid for their first national title since the 2000 season. "Agonizingly close," coach Lincoln Riley said. His team was bowled over, on one play in particular. When Robert Barnes tried to stop Josh Jacobs in the open field, the Alabama running back lowered his head for the collision and continued to the end zone for a 27-yard score while the Sooners safety spun to the turf, dazed and briefly unable to get up. "When I saw an opportunity to score, I just tried my best to score," Jacobs said with a chuckle. Alabama had the ball for more than 36 minutes and totaled 528 yards. "Our offense really controlled the tempo of the game," Saban said. "The only time we really got stopped in the game is when we stopped ourselves." In a matchup between the two highest-scoring offenses in the country, Oklahoma fell too far behind early. On the first snap, DeVonta Smith turned Tagovailoa's short pass into a 50-yard gain. The Crimson Tide went on to score an Orange Bowl-record 21 points in the opening quarter. "It's not the result we wanted or expected," Riley said. "We had a hard time breaking their string of momentum. We dug ourselves too big a hole." At one point the disparity in yards was 191-0. The most noise the Sooners mustered in the early going was when linebacker Kenneth Murray talked trash with the Alabama bench -- with his team trailing by three touchdowns. The Sooners rallied and closed to within 11 points three times in the final 18 minutes. But two onside kicks failed, and Alabama ran the final 4:23 off the clock after Oklahoma's last score. QUICK START Alabama took the opening kickoff and drove 75 yards for a touchdown. Oklahoma was awarded a fumble recovery at the 1, but officials overturned the ruling following a replay review, and Damien Harris scored on the next play. The Sooners' first three plays lost 6 yards, forcing a punt, and eight plays later Tagovailoa hit Henry Ruggs III with a 10-yard touchdown pass. Tagovailoa threw deep to Jerry Jeudy for 40 yards to set up the Crimson Tide's third score, and Jacobs' catch and run for a touchdown made it 28-0. INJURY REPORT Tide linebacker Christian Miller limped to the locker room in the third quarter with a left hamstring injury. An MRI was planned, and his availability for the title game was uncertain, Saban said. TAKEAWAYS The Crimson Tide need one more win for their sixth national title in the past decade. They have a chance to finish 15-0, which hasn't been done at the top level of college football since Penn went 15-0 in 1897. Saban moved closer to his seventh national title, which would break the record he shares with the Crimson Tide's Bear Bryant. UP NEXT Alabama seeks its second consecutive title when it plays Clemson for the fourth postseason in a row. The Crimson Tide won 24-6 in the semifinal a year ago, and 45-40 in the title game for the 2016 season. Clemson beat Alabama for the championship 35-31 two years ago. The Sooners will begin another bid for their first national title since 2000 when they open the 2019 season at home against Houston on Aug. 31. ---- More AP college football: https://apnews.com/Collegefootball and https://twitter.com/AP-Top25

videos.headline: Alabama withstands Oklahoma surge, advances to CFP title game
videos.description: Tua Tagovailoa throws for 318 yards and 4 touchdowns as Alabama survives 417 yards and 3 scores from Kyler Murray to win the Capital One Orange Bowl.

tracking.trackingName: COM_NCF Highlight (Alabama withstands Oklahoma surge, advances to CFP title game) 2018/12/29 ESHEET SOTFULL

videos.headline: Clemson and Bama win to set up Round 4
videos.description: For the fourth consecutive year, the championship journeys of the Tigers and Tide feature a must-win showdown in the College Football Playoff.

tracking.trackingName: COM_NCF Highlight (Clemson and Bama win to set up round four) 2018/12/29 ESHEET ENHL

videos.headline: Crimson Tide overrun Sooners in Orange Bowl
videos.description: Tua Tagovailoa throws 4 touchdown passes as Alabama withstands Oklahoma's late surge in the Capital One Orange Bowl.

tracking.trackingName: COM_NCF Highlight (Crimson Tide overrun Sooners in Orange Bowl) 2018/12/30 ESHEET SCEU

videos.headline: Tua throws 50-yard pass on 1st play
videos.description: Tua Tagovailoa fires a pass over the middle to DeVonta Smith for a 50-yard gain on the first play from scrimmage in the Orange Bowl.

videos.headline: Alabama avoids disaster with overturned fumble
videos.description: Alabama RB Damien Harris' fumble is overturned upon review, as his elbow hits the ground before the ball jars loose at the 1-yard line.

videos.headline: Alabama strikes first with Harris TD
videos.description: Damien Harris plows across the goal line to cap off Alabama's 75-yard opening drive.

videos.headline: Ruggs makes circus catch for Alabama's 2nd TD
videos.description: Tua Tagovailoa lofts a pass into the end zone and Henry Ruggs III hauls in a tough catch for a 10-yard touchdown to extend Alabama's lead.

videos.headline: Alabama takes Murray's pass to end zone, but ruled incomplete
videos.description: Kyler Murray swings a pass out to his left and Alabama picks it up and takes it to the end zone, but the play is ruled a forward pass after review.

videos.headline: Jeudy hangs on to Tua's dime between defenders
videos.description: Tua Tagovailoa throws downfield and fits a pass between Oklahoma defenders to connect with Jerry Jeudy for a 40-yard gain.

videos.headline: Harris puts Alabama up by 3 TDs in 1st quarter
videos.description: Damien Harris finds the end zone for the second time from a yard away, putting Alabama up by three touchdowns vs. Oklahoma.

videos.headline: 'Overrated' chants break out after Oklahoma's failed fourth down attempt
videos.description: Kyler Murray's incomplete pass generates a series of "overrated" chants at the Capital One Orange Bowl.

videos.headline: Alabama's Jacobs trucks Oklahoma DB on way to end zone
videos.description: Tua Tagovailoa throws to Josh Jacobs in the flat and he takes it 27 yards for a score, bulldozing the Oklahoma defender in his path.

videos.headline: Sermon finds big hole to put Oklahoma on the board
videos.description: Trey Sermon takes a direct snap into the end zone from two yards out to score Oklahoma's first points of the Orange Bowl.

videos.headline: Ruggs makes circus catch for Alabama's 2nd TD
videos.description: Tua Tagovailoa lofts a pass into the end zone and Henry Ruggs III hauls in a tough catch for a 10-yard touchdown to extend Alabama's lead.

tracking.trackingName: NCF_One-Play (Ruggs makes circus catch for Alabama's 2nd TD) 2018/12/29 ESHEET

videos.headline: Lamb levels Alabama defender on Murray's 1st-down run
videos.description: CeeDee Lamb nails an Alabama defender to spring Kyler Murray for a first down on an 11-yard gain.

videos.headline: Saban slams headset after Alabama false start
videos.description: Nick Saban gets heated and smashes his headset to the turf after Alabama is flagged for another false start in the second quarter.

videos.headline: Tua, Bama control first half vs. Oklahoma
videos.description: Tua Tagovailoa throws for 224 yards and 2 TDs and Damien Harris adds two rushing scores as Alabama holds a 31-10 halftime lead over Oklahoma.

tracking.trackingName: COM_NCF Highlight (Tua, Bama control first half vs. Oklahoma) 2018/12/29 ESHEET SotFull

videos.headline: Murray launches 49-yard TD to Rambo
videos.description: Kyler Murray keeps Oklahoma alive with a perfect 49-yard touchdown pass to Charleston Rambo in the third quarter.

videos.headline: Tua answers Oklahoma TD with 10-yard score
videos.description: Tua Tagovailoa finds DeVonta Smith on a slant for a 10-yard touchdown, padding Alabama's lead in the fourth quarter.

videos.headline: Murray rifles TD to Lamb, keeping Oklahoma's hopes alive
videos.description: Kyler Murray hits CeeDee Lamb with a back-shoulder pass for a 10-yard touchdown as Oklahoma stays within reach of Alabama.

videos.headline: Tua's 4th TD pass goes to Jeudy
videos.description: Tua Tagovailoa throws another touchdown pass across the middle, this time to Jerry Jeudy for a 13-yard score.

videos.headline: Oklahoma won't go away with Murray's 8-yard TD run
videos.description: Kyler Murray looks to throw, but keeps it himself for an 8-yard touchdown run as Oklahoma continues to stay alive vs. Alabama.

videos.headline: Saban: 'Killed ourselves' with penalties to end 1st half
videos.description: Nick Saban says "there is no scoreboard" and Alabama needs to keep playing hard vs. Oklahoma in the second half.

videos.headline: Riley says Sooners are capable of comeback
videos.description: Lincoln Riley admits the Sooners took a while to find a rhythm, but can mount a comeback with their dynamic offense led by Kyler Murray.

videos.headline: Saban: 'I'm really proud of our team. It's a great win'
videos.description: Nick Saban says there's a lot Alabama needs to do to improve, but praises the Crimson Tide's focus in the Orange Bowl vs. Oklahoma.

videos.headline: Tua says ankle 'still uncertain,' credits defense
videos.description: Despite throwing for 318 yards and four touchdowns, Tua Tagovailoa says the status of his ankle is "still uncertain."

videos.headline: Riley: 'We fought our guts out'
videos.description: Lincoln Riley reflects on the Sooners' 45-34 loss to Alabama in the Capital One Orange Bowl, saying his team proudly fought until the finish.

tracking.trackingName: COM_NCF Interview (Riley: 'We fought our guts out') 2018/12/29 SVP

videos.headline: Saban's headset smash broken down in the Film Room
videos.description: Herm Edwards and the rest of the Film Room react to Nick Saban throwing his headset after an Alabama false start penalty.

tracking.trackingName: COM_NCF Analysis (Saban’s headset smash broken down in the Film Room) 2018/12/29 ESHEET

videos.headline: Alabama's hot start key to victory
videos.description: Kirk Herbstreit and Chris Fowler break down Alabama's win including their hot start and also put a bow on a remarkable season for Kyler Murray.

videos.headline: Davis: Saban said Sooners' offense was toughest he's ever faced
videos.description: Rece Davis joins Scott Van Pelt to break down Alabama's win over Oklahoma and Nick Saban's difficulties with Kyler Murray.

tracking.trackingName: COM_NCF Analysis (Davis: Saban said Sooners’ offense was toughest he's ever faced) 2018/12/30 SVP
